theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in proteasome activity and structural changes impairing protein degradation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteasome dysfunction with aging and its impact on protein quality control and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes proteasome functional decline with age and its link to cellular senescence and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights proteasome activity decline and therapeutic potential of proteasome activators in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details proteasome dysfunction mechanisms including subunit modifications and inhibition by damaged proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in proteolytic systems including proteasome and autophagy as causal in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on USP7 regulation of ubiquitin-proteasome system and autophagy affecting proteostasis and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on CHIP as a key regulator of proteostasis and cellular senescence via protein quality control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: General proteostasis decline theory emphasizing impaired folding, repair, and degradation of proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proteostasis collapse involving ER stress, UPR, and misfolded protein accumulation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis decline with transcriptome-proteome decoupling and senoprotein accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights decline in protein quality control and accumulation of damaged proteins disrupting proteostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes translation-related constraints on proteostasis and loss of protein homeostasis in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related decline in proteostasis network components including chaperones and proteolytic machineries.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proteotoxicity from misfolded proteins and impaired degradation systems driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details role of Hsp70 chaperones in protein quality control and longevity assurance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p38Kb and BAG3/starvin pathway regulating selective autophagy and protein homeostasis in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Regulation and Quality Control Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes reduced mRNA translation decreases erroneous protein load, improving proteostasis and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Redox Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on reversible thiol oxidation of proteostasis proteins as redox switches modulating aging-related proteostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Redox Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mTOR-mediated translational attenuation enhancing proteostasis and stress resilience downstream of redox signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Redox Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of chemically altered proteins from oxidative and glycation damage affecting proteostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Redox Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of toxic protein aggregates like Aβ42 due to impaired clearance and increased vulnerability with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Aggregation and Spatial Confinement Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes spatial regulation of protein aggregates, confinement mechanisms, and prion-like assemblies in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Aggregation and Spatial Confinement Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on long-lived protein damage accumulation in tissues like the eye lens contributing to aging.
